item.description:
As long as it's not pouring rain, this should be a beautiful hike. We'll head up along the edge of Pine Acres Lake to Governor's Island. You'll want hiking boots or at least sneakers, because it can be a bit muddy at points.

The hike will probably take about two hours, so bring a bottle of water and a snack, if you like.
Most of the trail is flat and not at all technical -- there is one patch which has a lot of boulders we'll need to clamber over, a couple of small streams to cross, but nothing steep.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the parking area opposite the museum before we begin the hike.

group.name: The NorthEast Connecticut Friends Meetup Group

item.name: May Hike to Governor's Island
